Translated_Text: Pass my greetings to your children.
You're afraid to pull up the net, aren't you?
Orig_Translated_Text: you are afraid to pull up the net, aren't you?
I'm with you (more than one person).

Translated_Text: I almost go (but I am not going to go).
I said (to myself), “Kaywerye evidently doesn't like me”.

Primary_Text: onà wyaro nkekonà bàryekomo, tàyonà wya
Analyzed_Word: onɨ	wjaro	n-ka-jakonɨ	bɨrʲekomo	tɨ-jonɨ	wja
Translated_Text: This is what the boy said to his mother.
Orig_Gloss: this like he-said-it boy his-mother to

Comment: Syllable reduction and assimilation of ‘to fly’?

Translated_Text: I always bathe in this river.
Orig_Translated_Text: Eu me banho sempre nesse rio

Translated_Text: “Did s/he leave?”, I say to him.
Orig_Translated_Text: '¿Será que se fue? le dije a él.'

Translated_Text: Then I was already grown up.
